subject: AI & Agents
title: GPU Serving: Maximizing Throughput
description: A quick win: understand GPU Serving: Maximizing Throughput.

hook.text: One GPU costs $2/hour. Serving one request at a time wastes 90% of its capacity.

buildup.text: GPU utilization depends on batching requests together to fill the GPU's parallel compute.

discovery.text: Dynamic batching collects requests within a time window and processes them in one GPU call.

twist.text: Larger batches improve throughput but increase latency. The sweet spot depends on SLAs.

climax.text: Serving frameworks (Triton, vLLM, TGI) handle batching, scheduling, and memory management.

punchline.text: Fill the GPU. Every idle cycle is wasted money.

quiz.question: Why is dynamic batching important for GPU serving?
options: It groups requests to maximize GPU utilization
It eliminates the need for GPUs
